Reviews.Title: “Disgusting place, don't let the price convince you”
Reviews.Author: Hispaniard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night on Christmas. It shouldn't have the name "hotel" as it looks more like a prison, a poultry farm or even a concentration camp. My floor consisted of a big room full of extremely tiny male rooms with no ceiling, like a beehive. It was too hot even to sleep. Funny smells everywhere. I don't know what was on the first floor, but it looked like homeless shelter and it stinks disguntingly. Don't expect any complementary service, or any help, at reception they don't even speak English and they are just careless, so many people in and out all the time... If you are a budget traveler, please look for another place even out on Manhattan like in Brooklyn where subway will take you fast to the island. But never, never go to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, run fast - NEVER stay here.”
Reviews.Author: MarquetteGrad
Reviews.Content: Booked 6 nights - fled after one. They can keep my money - just to get out of the cat dropping rodent infested dump. NEVER stay here. I tried to save money and it was a STUPID decision on my part. I read the bad reviews and thought "no place can be that bad". It is. NYC is doing a disservice to tourists by letting this thing stay open. I would not stay here even if it was free. You pay me $100 per night, and then I might say. The showers were filthy and could here people in the next box zipping and upzipping their zippers. NEVER, EVER stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a tenant in Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: JC0485
Reviews.Content: As you can see from the other review earlier, I also stayed here during New Years Eve. I already expected to walk up five flights of stairs to my room before I came here (no elevators). It was a minor inconvenience for me since I'm still a young guy, but the stairs are really steep just to let you all know. For someone with a lot of heavy luggage, I wouldn't even consider this place. Shared bathrooms were not clean and was not stocked with toiletries (toilet paper, soap, etc). For some reason the whole toilet paper roll was wet but still in the holder. My folded blanket still had pieces of hair in it, therefore it was probably not even washed and just refolded. They leave you some a basic bar of soap, disposable toothbrush and little toothpaste packet as their last and only attempt at hospitality. The place needs air freshener, stunk of body odor. I expected as much since as you can read from the other reviews, so many bodies close together and the rooms aren't exactly closed, the ceilings of the closet sized rooms are closed off by some type of metal chicken coop wire. Didn't see any cockroaches thank God, I guess they fixed that problem. I did smell an amalgam of pungent odors as I walked up to my floor. A mix of cat excrement and body odor from what I could figure out... I saw at least two naked chinese tenants walking around the 3rd and 4th floors. Goody.... Staff did their basic duties to get you a key, assign room, but basically they were just bodies.. not so much as one greeting as I arrived or thank you as we left. A vending machine would do a better job in their place. Paid total of $55 for one night, stayed her the night of New Years Eve. Probably cheaper on non-holidays. But still... too much for this place. My first night at a hostel. My friend who I stayed with here has had an extensive experience with hostels and said this was the worst one he's been in. ..Terrific. To be honest I slept like a baby, I guess it was my desire to block out all the unpleasantness I was experiencing at this hostel. My friend on the other hand, had trouble sleeping because he was next to some loud snorers and one british dude that was talking loudly on the phone until 4 am. Again, you will hear everything from the other rooms. The walls are just their visual privacy. The only good things I can say? Well you have your own private dorm with a white light lamp and.. there's a decent bed... At least I'm happy to know they're not all like this. Glad it was only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Its like a Prison Camp”
Reviews.Author: SAGAR A
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here over the New Years Eve and I would not let my animals stay here.You will Not get any peace during the night and when I got their their was a disabled man trying to come down the stairs,they were a nightmare.I felt I was in a prison during the night and all the rooms had chicken wire above them so if anyone is snoring in another room you will hear it and if anyone is talking out loud you will not get any peace.Their is free internet access but you have to be quick to get their first as their is only one computer.The area is in Chinatown and its very condensed.The reception staff didnt give any monkeys about you and dont understand english that well.

Reviews.Title: “Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: Rez K
Reviews.Content: I do not normally write reviews of my hotel stays but felt morally obliged in this instance. I had to book a room at short notice for my stay in New York and this was the cheapest option by far in the Manhattan area. I stayed there for 2 weeks. Any longer then I would have paid the extra to get a 'normal' hotel. Anyhow the room was on the fifth floor and there are no elevators so I recommend traveling lightly. Floors 3 and 4 are for permanent residents and it shows, they live in quite dismal conditions and almost make the guest floors look like a luxury residence. The room itself is tiny with no ceiling other than chicken gauze/wire. No sink/mirror and only a very basic area to store your belongings...you have to be creative in order not to for the area not to get too untidy. So given the room structure and dimensions you need to bring ear plugs and an eye mask since you can hear every movement of the people on the floor. They do not turn off the lights at night , that is the reason for the eye mask . There were 5 shower/restroom facilities on the floor and I never had to wait to get in one and there was always hot water. Bring flip flops so that you use these areas hygienically. That is all there is to this place. For the money it is well located, but if you are a light sleeper then you will have a hard time resting. It is only a place to come back to after you have spent the whole day sightseeing so it does encourage you to spend time outside of the hotel since there is nothing to do inside the place itself. Would I go there again? Only if my back was against the wall and my options were very limited. I was in an unusual situation given the short amount of time that I had to book the flight and hotel and also the amount of time that I needed to spend in NYC. The next cheapest option in Manhattan was about 3 times as expensive, so given my circumstances I am actually quite grateful that the Sunbright hotel was there to fill an unusual requirement for me. On a 'normal' vacation for me which would last a week I would not consider it. It is for single people only not for a family. I only required a place to sleep which was in Manhattan and it served it's purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “absolute nightmare! NOT worth the money saved!”
Reviews.Author: will d
Reviews.Content: I am usually not very picky about hotels, which is why I originally chose the Sun Bright (mainly for its low cost in such an expensive city). I have stayed in hostels all over Central America and Asia and Europe. This, in comparison, has got to be the worst I have ever stayed in. The sheets were dirty and stained when I got to my room. The showers were infested with roaches. The dorm is literally a chicken coup, with chicken wire separating room from room. A word from experience, pay a little more and get a better hotel. This is not a place to take children or family.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap and rememberable experience”
Reviews.Author: FrisoO
Reviews.Content: The single 'room' (bunk really) I was in was on the 5th floor, but before you get there you have to pass the other floors where a lot of Chinese people are staying. Or living actually. Each floor is a big hall with beds, and each bed has wooden walls around it, so it's sorta private, but also not. Those halls resemble slave like conditions, I will never forget that view. The 5th floor is the same concept, but given the concept it's quite nicely done. You still however are only a wooden wall away from your neighbors. On all 3 sides. There is no roof on your bunk, only chicken gauze. It's on a busy street, so I went to bed hearing my neighbors snore and woke up to the horns of New York traffic. Oh, and I skipped the showers, you share a shower with about 10 bunks, so the line was terrible. If you want a cheap stay and experience Chinatown, this is your place, but if you are looking for a hotel: look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: trav848587
Reviews.Content: We had booked two nights at the hotel but when we arrived there was apparently no more room! On inquiry we were told that they apparently with the travel agency we booked no longer work together? Don't book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Initially shocking but actually reasonable”
Reviews.Author: wolfpackmember
Reviews.Content: When I first walked into the dorm at the Sun Hotel in Chinatown I was shocked. It looked like a chiken coup. There were scores of tiny 'bedrooms' placed next to one another in a pen-like fashion. Upon opening the door to my room I was surprised again at how small the space was. It is literally enough space for a small single mattress with enough walkway to shuffle down one side of the bed. Having overcome the initial shock I actually realised that this, at the price of a budget hostel actually offers significantly more privacy. The space is tiny but at least its 'your space'. The rooms are very clean and the mattress comfortable. There are two plug sockets and your own light switch. Those are the plus points. Unfortunately there is no ceiling to the rooms, in fact it is a sheet of chicken wire, presumably to stop people snooping into the next room. This also means that at no point during the day or night is it ever remotely dark. The hallway lights are on all night and therefore an eye mask and ear plugs are a must! The service is less than satisfactory but not attrocious. The 5 flight walk up, with heavy luggage, not ideal but at a low price...it's OK. One more note - Wi-Fi is free but painfully slow and renders itself practically useless.

Reviews.Title: “voleur,”
Reviews.Author: patrick m
Reviews.Content: they charge for the room on my credit card after the cancelation one week before...we call to cancell we send a e-mail like they ask to do.. good luck if you paid whit your credit card ....there chinese people , do not speak and understand english verry good and do not care , they dont care and they just want your money, i am trying to get my money back.. they still try to charge me one week after...i have to cancell my credit card..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrific”
Reviews.Author: cent61014
Reviews.Content: If only i could rate this a minus 500000 to counter those who didnt rate it as 1. Perhaps they stayed in shared rooms, but i created a tripadvisor account for the sole reason of giving this place a terrible score. I have stayed in some horrible hostels and never complained, i couldnt care less as its just a bed to sleep in, but this place really takes the biscuit. First off you get what you pay for doesnt really apply, 75 pounds for two nights is not cheap as far as anywhere in the us is concerned, including major cities like miami, boston, and LA. The room is two small for two single beds to fit in, the sheets are dirty, you immediatel drag your 70 lbs of luggage up 6 flights of steps and dont be fooled into thinking i was unlucky, you are always on 5 or 6 as the other floors are genuinely used to keep livestock ! The worst part are the staff, arrogant, irritating, refusing to help or speak the basics of the English language, never have i encountered such a rude and incompetent staff. Oh and if you are unfortunate enough to be on the 6th floor dont expect any sleep as the noisy fans creak constantly as is the noise from the street. 0 on ammenties, 0 on clenliness, 0 on staff, i am writing this review from the room funnily enough the internet has worked for the first time in 2 days and im about to get to the airport 8 hours early for my flight as i would genuinely rather sleep in the terminal of JFK. But yes, decent location.

Reviews.Title: “This was like being in a prison cell but without the bars!!”
Reviews.Author: alan_f_1975
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much when I arrived at this hotel, (if you can call it that), but I was expecting something a bit more than this. First of all there are no lifts. Unfortunately I was on the 5th floor so it was something of a trek with a large heavy suitcase. The room was probably about 6ft wide and about 7ft long. Barely enough room to turn around once they had put a bed in there. The bed was formed of a thin mattress on a wooden frame. There was 1 blanket and 1 pillow. There was also 1 towel in the room. Extremely basic it makes a Travelodge room look like a palace!! The bathrooms were communal which I was aware of so don't expect them to be clean all the time. In reception there was free internet but it was painfully slow I just ended up going to an internet cafe in the end. Overall it was dirty, smelly and resembled something out of a prison war camp. As it is situated in Chinatown and run by Chinese people, I think they expect you to live like them as well! Last but not least I don't know how they have the nerve to charge you for staying there as well. They should be paying you for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Never come here. seriously. i mean it.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey H
Reviews.Content: Well, I thought reviews were over exaggerated. i mean common 45 bucks for a night in downtown nyc? you get what you pay for! HOWEVER, 45 bucks is absolutely overcharging. I mean I understand the small rooms and dirty homeless shelter on 3rd and 4th floor, but after my first night, the lock in the room was changed for some reason, and i had to get a new key. and my clothes were missing. they said they have it in "locker" but who knows what they did with it. I'm really angry and there's no way they can either call it motel hotel or hostel. it's just homeless shelter avialable for travelers with charge..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with worst customer service EVER”
Reviews.Author: sam20093
Reviews.Content: This was possibly the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Horrible and unfriendly customer service, room condition was beyond awful, and the wi-fi sucked. Don't book your reservation at this hotel!!! SO NOT WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: “Crappiest hotel in NYC?”
Reviews.Author: topip
Reviews.Content: Location is pretty good, in Chinatown close to Little Italy, unless of course you don't like the fish smell of Chinatown. The staff doesn't speak much English and is not friendly. They claim to have free wireless internet, but it didn't for once for the 4 days I stayed there, though they have a public computer (with no chair so people wouldn't reserve it for long). The first thing you have to do when arriving there is carry your luggage to the fifth floor, which can get heavy. The room was more like a prison cell than a hotel room, I could barely fit my suitcase there. The room had no ceiling and the walls were thin, so you could hear everything from the dozens of rooms neighboring you. The bathrooms were dirty, one had some weird fungus growing from the drain, and most of the time the floor is wet because they also have the only showers. Additionally, you had to wait in line for them, especially in the morning. The people in the hotel were mostly Chinese, but some of them seemed (and behaved) like homeless people, which was not exactly soothing. In any other city in America the price would be expensive, but I guess in NYC you have to pay a lot more for a decent hotel or even a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Hester Street”
Reviews.Author: Francisco7478
Reviews.Content: To everyone who thinks on going to this hotel, dont! The pics that they show on their site is not what u will expect to get. The room was very small, they controlled the ac unit and u had a big desk fan mounted on the wall. I did not even have my own bathroom, i would have to share it with the other tennets, if u think that is bad ,the bathroom had a fly catcher hanging from the ceiling over the toilet. The person at the desk was rude to me and my female friend who i known for years. He really did not help us, he told us that the rooms i reserved was for male only, and that i could stay but she had to go to another hotel. we decided to just leave, and let them charge a one night stay and get refunded for the rest of the nights we were supose to stay. After my trip, the website where i made the reservations was telling me that the hotel was saying that istayed there for the whole time. They were trying to rip me off also. i told them i will give them the name, address, and phone number where i stayed for my trip when i cancelled my reservation i had with them. I REPEAT DO NOT GO THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: SydGirls
Reviews.Content: This Hostel is in a great location. It is close to China Town and Little Italy and is only a short stroll to Soho. The rooms are small and the bed feels like you are sleeping on concret! It is not worth what I paid to stay there and they over charged me for the rooms! Still waiting to get refunded the extra they charged.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nytravelnightmare
Reviews.Content: I arrived here at 3 in the morning at was furiouse when i arrived!this isnt a hotel! the room was the closest thing to prison i have ever been in, honestly you need to know what youre getting yourself into before you commit to booking a room here because i wish sombody would have told me! the rooms are 4 feet wide and 7 feet long, LITURALLY!!!! there is no ceiling! you can hear all of youre neighbors! you can hear people 5 rooms down as if they were next door! the cheap asians that own this wreck used chicken wire for a ceiling instead of drywall! i LITRUALLY could not sleep due to the loudsnoring of my neighbors!!!! every1 that arrived was shocked and dissapointed!there is probuablly 80 rooms sardined into one floor LITRUALLY! and all 80 of you share 4 dirty low quality bathrooms! stay away its not worth it! just stay in newark you can get a real room for the same price, i wish i would have.

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap Hostel”
Reviews.Author: ALP86
Reviews.Content: Lets be honest this is not an hotel, its a hostel. The rooms are tiny (a single bed, a ft to the left and a door at the end), they come with a TV and have no windows or control over the air con (Its one of those air cons that's been recovered from a Harrier Jump Jet and comes on a random throughout the night. The walls are almost plastic like the kind you'd find on a large ferry. Sleeping is hard. The bathrooms are very decent, clean and bigger than most rooms. I stayed at the Sun Bright for the best part of three weeks while conducting my Ph.D fieldwork. As my budget was limited this was the cheapest place I could find with single rooms for around $50/night (something I needed for work, leave laptops in etc). I would recommend it for a backpacker needing a short stay on their way through the city but this really isn't for the holiday maker or for the inexperienced traveller! The staff also have a poor standard of English with the elderly night porter being particularly rude and unhelpful. The location is great on the end of Canal street near the Manhattan Bridge. Easily the worst 'hotel' I've been in but just a basic below average hostel. BTW rooms are NOT as cheap as the advertise as they don't include TAX when quoting you a price. When you get there the bill substantially more than they quote upon booking. Also Internet is not free as elsewhere stated.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Camacho87
Reviews.Content: I would stay away from this hostel! Upon arrival, we were stuck in a huge queue as there were no rooms ready and it was past the check in time. The guy behind the desk didnt seem to know what he was doing. As there were no rooms he told me to leave our suitcases in the office but I didnt feel this was safe as anyone could just walk in and take their luggage with no questions asked. So we just waited. While waiting for a room to become available, a girl arrived at the hotel asking to speak to the manager because they had double charged her credit card. The guy didnt seem to care and just said the manager wasnt in until the next day. I also heard of another incident like this in the hotel during our stay. We didnt have a problem but we payed in cash. The hostel was dirty and small and just didnt have a nice feel to it. We had payed for a double room but were given bunkbeds with literally no room to move at all. It was the smallest room I have ever been in! They said there was nothing they could do as they had no more rooms. There was always a queue for the bathrooms as well - these were bigger than our room! We just spent most of our time in this hostel waiting to be seen to. It was a nightmare. I would defo stay away and look for somewhere out of Chinatown!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ageing-hippie
Reviews.Content: This is a Hostel rather than a Hotel because it has shared facilites - which were cleaned regularly during our 4 day stay. Rooms are small (don't travel with a cat) and bare. Location is in grubby, littered Chinatown but it is close to 2 subway stations for access to the rest of New York. Bowery station being excellent to get to JFK airport. Free internet provided. If you like to stretch out in your room for a rest occasionally this isn't for you. If you just want somewhere to dump your stuff and sleep, spending the rest of the time outside, it's OK. It's good value as long as you remember it is very cheap for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service - Definitely would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: shouti
Reviews.Content: The old guy called Myint Aung was very rude to me . He tossed keys around and even shouted at me for no reason . The worst hotel experience I have experienced in my whole entire life - Definitely would not recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean!”
Reviews.Author: erika_23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sun Bright Hotel last week (March 16-21 2010). It is located in chinatown, a few blocks north of Little Italy. The rooms are small, its true. You have little room to move around, but really, who goes to New-York to walk around their room? The bed is a bit hard but I love hard beds so I was happy. The double rooms at the end all have windows and sinks. Each room also has a mirror. We stayed in a total of 3 different rooms because we stayed longer than planned and our original room had already been booked for another couple. Each room was clean, bug-free, with fresh towels on the bed waiting for us. There's also a tv in the corner with a remote (not that you need one with the size of the rooms) and you get 6 channels; one being HBO which is great. There are 4 bathrooms to be shared on the floor, but they are private and lockable so you get a lot of privacy. They are clean and did not flood like someone else mentionned when we were there. There's even a computer at the end of the hall with internet access. Although theres a sign that mentions you need to buy an access card, it always worked without the card and we surfed the web for free whenever we needed. There are 2 subway stations nearby, one on Grand Street which leads to the west upper side of town and one on Canal street which is the East upper line. Its also a 5 minute walk from the Brooklyn bridge and about a 10- 15 mins walk from Ground Zero and Battery Park.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable. Double room too small.”
Reviews.Author: bariforlife
Reviews.Content: I found the staff very helpful and friendly. No lift, which makes dragging a heavy suitcase up stairs hard, and stairs are quite steep. I would stay there again as it's very central. Yummy food not far away. Female - 47yrs Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Dirty and Full of bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: buttonnosehead
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sun Bright in late November, after the hotel I was meant to be staying in lost my reservation. This hotel was all I could afford before moving to another part of the USA. The price is a rip off, I stayed in a double bed room, and could not fit my suitcase in (it slept on the bed with me). I had a fight with the light switch everytime I went in and me and a couple of cockroaches became very good mates by the second night. The walls are paper thin and mine were covered in some green substance. You can definetly hear everything going on in the surrounding rooms. The staff were rude, and you could not approach them about finding things like the subway or even how to get some where. The Sun Bright is a shared bath, you need to take your own towel if you do decide to stay here. They provide a towel, mine had obvious stains on it before I even unfolded it. The bathrooms, are dirty, disgusting, flood quite easily, and really arent cleaned properly every day. Take your own sheets, I ended up sleeping on my towel and used a jacket for a blanket. I would not recommend this hotel for any one.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: ac1234
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the 'hotel' the windowless room was dirty, the bed sheets werent changed and there were stains everywhere. When mentioned to reception, they sent someone straight to our room. The room itself was tiny. There was an uncomfortable double bed with flat pillows. The room could barely fit a suitcase. Also in the room there was a sink and a tv. There was no common room for everyone to hang out. The vending machines were either nearly empty or didnt work. Because there are men who stay in the hotel permanently we had to be buzzed through a secure door to get into the 'hotel' part of the building. Overall the place was really cheap and in the center of chinatown but I wont be staying there every again.
